definitions.text: the act of applying force in order to move something away
examples: he gave the door a hard push
the pushing is good exercise
the push of the water on the walls of the tank
the thrust of the jet engines
Europeans often laugh at American energy

definitions.text: an electrical switch operated by pressing
examples: the elevator was operated by push buttons
the push beside the bed operated a buzzer at the desk
the army made a push toward the sea
He pushed the table into a corner

definitions.text: press, drive, or impel (someone) to action or completion of an action
examples: He pushed her to finish her doctorate

definitions.text: make publicity for; try to sell (a product)
examples: The salesman is aggressively pushing the new computer model
The company is heavily advertizing their new laptops

definitions.text: strive and make an effort to reach a goal
examples: She tugged for years to make a decent living
We have to push a little to make the deadline!
She is driving away at her doctoral thesis
she pushed against the wall with all her strength

definitions.text: approach a certain age or speed
examples: She is pushing fifty

definitions.text: exert oneself continuously, vigorously, or obtrusively to gain an end or engage in a crusade for a certain cause or person; be an advocate for
examples: The liberal party pushed for reforms
She is crusading for women's rights
The Dean is pushing for his favorite candidate

definitions.text: sell or promote the sale of (illegal goods such as drugs)
examples: The guy hanging around the school is pushing drugs
The crowd pushed forward

definitions.text: make strenuous pushing movements during birth to expel the baby
examples: `Now push hard,' said the doctor to the woman
